Title: Episternal ossicles
Content: Episternal ossicles or suprasternal ossicles are small bones that are sometimes present at the upper end of the chest bone The prevalence of these ossicles is around 15  Structure  The episternal ossicles are ovalshaped bones that are occasionally found at the superior and posterior border of the manubrium The episternal ossicles were first described by Cobb in 1937 They may be present unilaterally or bilaterally Its size ranges from 215 mm depending on individuals These ossicles are asymptomatic and does not cause any harm although it may be diagnosed as fracture vascular ossification or calcified lymph nodes
